member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.AddFNSPUserToPermissionGroupCmdlet
member.summary: Adds a user account to a permission group to grant permissions for actions a user can perform in FinSpace.

para.para: The unique identifier for the permission group.
The unique identifier for the user.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.AddFNSPUserToPermissionGroupCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'StatusCode'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.AssociateUserToPermissionGroupResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.AssociateUserToPermissionGroupResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.AddFNSPUserToPermissionGroupCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.DisableFNSPUserCmdlet

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.DisableFNSPUserCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.GetFNSPExternalDataViewAccessDetailCmdlet
member.summary:
Returns the credentials to access the external Dataview from an S3 location. To call this API:
You must retrieve the programmatic credentials.
You must be a member of a FinSpace user group, where the dataset that you want to access has Read Dataset Data permissions.

para.para: The unique identifier for the Dataset.
The unique identifier for the Dataview that you want to access.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.GetFNSPWorkingLocationCmdlet
member.summary: A temporary Amazon S3 location, where you can copy your files from a source location to stage or use as a scratch space in FinSpace notebook.

para.para: Specify the type of the working location.

li.para: SAGEMAKER – Use the Amazon S3 location as a temporary location to store data content when working with FinSpace Notebooks that run on SageMaker studio.
INGESTION – Use the Amazon S3 location as a staging location to copy your data content and then use the location with the Changeset creation operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.GetFNSPWorkingLocationCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.GetWorkingLocationResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.GetWorkingLocationResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.GetFNSPWorkingLocationCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the LocationType parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^LocationType' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPChangesetCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new Changeset in a FinSpace Dataset.

para.para: The option to indicate how a Changeset will be applied to a Dataset.

li.para: REPLACE – Changeset will be considered as a replacement to all prior loaded Changesets.
APPEND – Changeset will be considered as an addition to the end of all prior loaded Changesets.
MODIFY – Changeset is considered as a replacement to a specific prior ingested Changeset.

para.para: The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset where the Changeset will be created.

Options that define the structure of the source file(s) including the format type (formatType), header row (withHeader), data separation character (separator) and the type of compression (compression).
formatType is a required attribute and can have the following values:

li.para: PARQUET – Parquet source file format.
CSV – CSV source file format.
JSON – JSON source file format.
XML – XML source file format.

para.para: Here is an example of how you could specify the formatParams:
Note that if you only provide formatType as CSV, the rest of the attributes will automatically default to CSV values as following:
For more information about supported file formats, see Supported Data Types and File Formats in the FinSpace User Guide.
Options that define the location of the data being ingested (s3SourcePath) and the source of the changeset (sourceType).
Both s3SourcePath and sourceType are required attributes.
Here is an example of how you could specify the sourceParams:

The S3 path that you specify must allow the FinSpace role access. To do that, you first need to configure the IAM policy on S3 bucket. For more information, see Loading data from an Amazon S3 Bucket using the FinSpace API section.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPChangesetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreateChangesetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreateChangesetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPChangesetCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.summary: Creates a new FinSpace Dataset.

para.para: The unique resource identifier for a Dataset.
List of column definitions.
Description of a Dataset.
List of resource permissions.
Display title for a FinSpace Dataset.
Email address for the Dataset owner.
The format in which Dataset data is structured.

li.para: TABULAR – Data is structured in a tabular format.
NON_TABULAR – Data is structured in a non-tabular format.

para.para: The name of the Dataset owner.
The unique identifier for the PermissionGroup.
Phone number for the Dataset owner.
List of column names used for primary key.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPDataViewCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a Dataview for a Dataset.

para.para: Beginning time to use for the Dataview. The value is determined as epoch time in milliseconds. For example, the value for Monday, November 1, 2021 12:00:00 PM UTC is specified as 1635768000000.
Flag to indicate Dataview should be updated automatically.
The unique Dataset identifier that is used to create a Dataview.
Destination type for a Dataview.

li.para: GLUE_TABLE – Glue table destination type.
S3 – S3 destination type.

para.para: Ordered set of column names used to partition data.
Dataview export file format.

li.para: PARQUET – Parquet export file format.
DELIMITED_TEXT – Delimited text export file format.

para.para: Format Options for S3 Destination type.
Here is an example of how you could specify the s3DestinationExportFileFormatOptions
Columns to be used for sorting the data.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreateDataViewResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPPermissionGroupCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a group of permissions for various actions that a user can perform in FinSpace.

para.para: The option to indicate FinSpace application permissions that are granted to a specific group.

important.para: When assigning application permissions, be aware that the permission ManageUsersAndGroups allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in their FinSpace environment's application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

li.para: CreateDataset – Group members can create new datasets.
ManageClusters – Group members can manage Apache Spark clusters from FinSpace notebooks.

ManageUsersAndGroups – Group members can manage users and permission groups. This is a privileged permission that allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in the application. It should only be granted to trusted users.
ManageAttributeSets – Group members can manage attribute sets.
ViewAuditData – Group members can view audit data.
AccessNotebooks – Group members will have access to FinSpace notebooks.
GetTemporaryCredentials – Group members can get temporary API credentials.

para.para: A brief description for the permission group.
The name of the permission group.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPPermissionGroupCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'PermissionGroupId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreatePermissionGroupResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreatePermissionGroupResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPPermissionGroupCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the Name parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^Name' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPUserCmdlet
member.summary: Creates a new user in FinSpace.

para.para: The option to indicate whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

li.para: ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.
DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

para.para: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.
The email address of the user that you want to register. The email address serves as a uniquer identifier for each user and cannot be changed after it's created.
The first name of the user that you want to register.
The last name of the user that you want to register.
The option to indicate the type of user. Use one of the following options to specify this parameter:

li.para: SUPER_USER – A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.
APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

para.para: A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPUserCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'UserId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreateUserResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.CreateUserResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.NewFNSPUserCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.RemoveFNSPDatasetCmdlet
member.summary: Deletes a FinSpace Dataset.

para.para: The unique identifier of the Dataset to be deleted.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.RemoveFNSPDatasetCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'DatasetId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.DeleteDatasetResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.DeleteDatasetResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.RemoveFNSPDatasetCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the DatasetId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^DatasetId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.RemoveFNSPDatasetCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.ResetFNSPUserPasswordCmdlet
member.summary: Resets the password for a specified user ID and generates a temporary one. Only a superuser can reset password for other users. Resetting the password immediately invalidates the previous password associated with the user.

para.para: The unique identifier of the user that a temporary password is requested for.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.UpdateFNSPChangesetCmdlet
member.summary: Updates a FinSpace Changeset.

para.para: The unique identifier for the Changeset to update.
The unique identifier for the FinSpace Dataset in which the Changeset is created.

Options that define the structure of the source file(s) including the format type (formatType), header row (withHeader), data separation character (separator) and the type of compression (compression).
formatType is a required attribute and can have the following values:

li.para: PARQUET – Parquet source file format.
CSV – CSV source file format.
JSON – JSON source file format.
XML – XML source file format.

para.para: Here is an example of how you could specify the formatParams:
Note that if you only provide formatType as CSV, the rest of the attributes will automatically default to CSV values as following:
For more information about supported file formats, see Supported Data Types and File Formats in the FinSpace User Guide.
Options that define the location of the data being ingested (s3SourcePath) and the source of the changeset (sourceType).
Both s3SourcePath and sourceType are required attributes.
Here is an example of how you could specify the sourceParams:

The S3 path that you specify must allow the FinSpace role access. To do that, you first need to configure the IAM policy on S3 bucket. For more information, see Loading data from an Amazon S3 Bucket using the FinSpace APIsection.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.UpdateFNSPDatasetCmdlet
member.summary: Updates a FinSpace Dataset.

para.para: The unique resource identifier for a Dataset.
List of column definitions.
A description for the Dataset.
The unique identifier for the Dataset to update.
A display title for the Dataset.
The format in which the Dataset data is structured.

li.para: TABULAR – Data is structured in a tabular format.
NON_TABULAR – Data is structured in a non-tabular format.

para.para: List of column names used for primary key.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.UpdateFNSPPermissionGroupCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the details of a permission group. You cannot modify a permissionGroupID.

para.para: The permissions that are granted to a specific group for accessing the FinSpace application.

important.para: When assigning application permissions, be aware that the permission ManageUsersAndGroups allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in their FinSpace environment's application. It should only be granted to trusted users.

li.para: CreateDataset – Group members can create new datasets.
ManageClusters – Group members can manage Apache Spark clusters from FinSpace notebooks.

ManageUsersAndGroups – Group members can manage users and permission groups. This is a privileged permission that allows users to grant themselves or others access to any functionality in the application. It should only be granted to trusted users.
ManageAttributeSets – Group members can manage attribute sets.
ViewAuditData – Group members can view audit data.
AccessNotebooks – Group members will have access to FinSpace notebooks.
GetTemporaryCredentials – Group members can get temporary API credentials.

para.para: A brief description for the permission group.
The name of the permission group.
The unique identifier for the permission group to update.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.UpdateFNSPPermissionGroupCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'PermissionGroupId'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.UpdatePermissionGroupResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.UpdatePermissionGroupResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the PermissionGroupId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^PermissionGroupId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.FNSP.UpdateFNSPUserCmdlet
member.summary: Modifies the details of the specified user account. You cannot update the userId for a user.

para.para: The option to indicate whether the user can use the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain credentials that can then be used to access other FinSpace Data API operations.

li.para: ENABLED – The user has permissions to use the APIs.
DISABLED – The user does not have permissions to use any APIs.

para.para: The ARN identifier of an AWS user or role that is allowed to call the GetProgrammaticAccessCredentials API to obtain a credentials token for a specific FinSpace user. This must be an IAM role within your FinSpace account.
The first name of the user.
The last name of the user.
The option to indicate the type of user.

li.para: SUPER_USER– A user with permission to all the functionality and data in FinSpace.
APP_USER – A user with specific permissions in FinSpace. The users are assigned permissions by adding them to a permission group.

para.para: The unique identifier for the user account to update.
A token that ensures idempotency. This token expires in 10 minutes.

Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.FinSpaceData.Model.UpdateUserResponse will result in that property being returned.
